creator: jhaynie@vocalocity.net
text:
The JAR task uses lowercase directory names when creating an archive. 
Directories under the top directory name (which is lowercase even if uppercase 
on disk) will be in the correct case.

This problem exists since 1.3 (at least)- Upgraded to 1.4.1 and the problem 
still exists.

Example disk layout:

/WEB-INF/web.xml
/WEB-INF/lib/some.jar

Jar contains:

/web-inf/web.xml
/WEB-INF/lib/some.jar


This is problematic when creating deployment archives that have case sensitive 
directories.

Note: I'm using the above as an example.  Our directory name is actually SB-
INF and we aren't creating a WAR so can't use the WAR task as an alternative 
unfortunately.

creator: jhaynie@vocalocity.net
text:
If you open the JAR using Winzip, the case is wrong.
If you run the JAR command JAR tvf and view the folder, the case is correct.

However, if you open the JAR programmatically, the case is wrong.

Might be a JDK bug.

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
I'm afraid this is indeed a JDK bug. 
#4442443
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4442443.html

creator: umagesh@apache.org
text:
Ant's Jar task creates case properly as evidenced by using jar tvf or jar xvf.
WinZip and JDK API problems apparently - we can't do anything about it.  Sorry.
Thanks for reporting anyway.  Closing this as invalid.
